instruction_text:
To fix Zoom audio problems:

1. Check audio settings in Zoom:
   - Click audio settings (speaker/microphone icon)
   - Test speaker: Click 'Test Speaker'
   - Test microphone: Click 'Test Mic'
   - Select correct audio devices from dropdown

2. Check Windows audio settings:
   - Right-click speaker icon > Open Sound settings
   - Verify correct output/input device selected
   - Test devices in Sound Control Panel
   - Check volume levels (not muted)

3. Join audio in Zoom:
   - Ensure 'Join Audio' is clicked in meeting
   - Choose 'Join with Computer Audio' not phone
   - Check audio button is not muted (red slash)

4. Update audio drivers:
   - Device Manager > Sound, video and game controllers
   - Right-click audio device > Update driver
   - Or download latest from manufacturer website

5. Restart audio services:
   - Services.msc > Windows Audio
   - Restart service if stopped
   - Restart Windows Audio Endpoint Builder

6. Check Zoom audio settings:
   - Zoom Settings > Audio
   - Enable 'Automatically join audio'
   - Check 'Suppress background noise' settings
   - Adjust speaker/mic volume

7. Test in different applications:
   - Play audio from other apps (YouTube, music)
   - Record audio in Windows Voice Recorder
   - Determine if issue is Zoom-specific or system-wide

8. Check browser version (if using web client):
   - Update browser to latest version
   - Check browser permissions allow microphone/speaker
   - Try different browser

9. Reinstall Zoom:
   - Uninstall Zoom completely
   - Delete Zoom folders from AppData
   - Download and reinstall latest version

10. Hardware troubleshooting:
    - Test headphones/speakers on different device
    - Check cable connections
    - Try different USB port if using USB headset
    - Test built-in vs external audio devices
